oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Captain Thomas Wells portrait
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sepia half-portrait of aged War of 1812 veteran Thomas Wells, carte de visite with decorative border. The bearded man is shown wearing a dark suit and bowtie. Oval photograph is decorated with swags and tassels and is topped with a fleur-de-lis.

Thomas Wells of Williamson County, Tennessee, served as a captain in the 2nd Regiment (Loury's) West Tennessee Militia during the Creek War. Wells was born in Virginia on May 1, 1782, and died in Spring Hill, Tennessee, June 4, 1860.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: New Orleans, Battle of, New Orleans, La., 1815;Southern States--History--War of 1812;Louisiana--History--War of 1812
